intro: Cyrtandra iriomotensis, commonly known as the Iriomote cyrtandra, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Iriomote in Japan. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. The plant is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and thrives in shaded, moist environments. It is also known for its distinctive, lance-shaped leaves and is considered an important species for the biodiversity of the region. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is classified as endangered.
